text:
Lennar is one of the
largest home builders in the

United States, operating
in over 26 states.
In the past, we had a lot of challenges
with separate siloed systems.

We struggled with data
latency and data quality

and by unifying it all together
within a Lakehouse
on AWS, our quality has gone up,
our availability has gone up
and our latency has gone way down.

I'm looking forward to the
Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio

because it will bring all
of the tooling together.

It will allow both our data
engineers, our data scientists

and our analysts to
operate out of one platform
and drive insights much more quickly.
One of the things that we anticipate doing
with the Amazon SageMaker Lakehouse is
to fully leverage the scale

that we've built out throughout
our S3 based data lake
and to put in production more

and more ML models that'll
drive insights, predictions,

and forecasts that'll
drive our business forward.

Building on AWS gives
us the enterprise scale

and support as well as the
ability to manage our cost.
It has been a game changer for us
as we've jumped into the ecosystem

and built out our
enterprise data Lakehouse.
By simplifying our data
and making it more available, we're able

to drive insights on everything
from pricing to materials
to our construction processes.

This not only will help our
customers receive their homes
quicker, but it'll also allow us
to be more competitive in the market.
One of the things that I'm excited about

as we move into the future with
AWS is leveraging the scale

and leveraging the technology
that they come to bear with.

We spent the last 18 months
building a foundation

and now we're going to spend the
next 18 months
building the future.
